intro: Campanula fragilis var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine, hairy texture, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and woodland borders.
